Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored a century with 104 runs from 64 balls, setting up a 65-run win for New Zealand over Sri Lanka.
Phillips hit 10 fours and four sixes, helping New Zealand reach a total of 167 runs.
Trent Boult captured 4 wickets for 13 runs, leading the New Zealand bowling attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Phillips received medical attention after suffering cramps during Sri Lanka's innings.
Commentators praised Phillips' performance, with Mel Jones and Dale Steyn highlighting his phenomenal knock.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's total of 167 runs never looked under threat as Sri Lanka was bowled out for 102 runs in 19.2 overs.
New Zealand is leading group one on five points, with England, Ireland, and Australia locked on three points.
